introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.paragraph1: This Privacy Policy describes how we collect, use, and protect your personal information when you use DotCTL ("the Software") or visit our website.
introduction.paragraph2: We are committed to protecting your privacy and complying with applicable data protection laws.

automatic.title: Information Collected Automatically
automatic.point1: Device and network information (IP address, network interface details)
automatic.point2: Software usage statistics and performance metrics
automatic.point4: Browser and operating system information when using our web services

provided.title: Information You Provide to Us
provided.point1: Email address and contact information when signing up for beta access
provided.point2: Feedback, bug reports, and feature requests you submit
provided.point3: Communication history when you contact our support team
provided.point4: Survey responses and user research data

use.title: How We Use Your Information
use.purpose1: To provide, maintain, and improve DotCTL
use.purpose2: To communicate with you about updates, features, and support
use.purpose3: To analyze usage patterns and improve user experience
use.purpose4: To diagnose technical issues and provide customer support
use.purpose5: To comply with legal obligations and enforce our Terms of Service
use.purpose6: To conduct research and development for future product features

sharing.title: Information Sharing and Disclosure
sharing.paragraph1: We do not sell, trade, or otherwise transfer your personal information to third parties without your consent, except as described in this Privacy Policy.
sharing.serviceProviders: We may share your information with trusted service providers who assist us in operating our website and software (e.g., hosting providers, analytics services), subject to strict confidentiality agreements.
sharing.legal: We may disclose your information if required by law, subpoena, or legal process, or to protect our rights or the safety of others.
sharing.aggregate: We may share aggregated and anonymized data about software usage for research and industry benchmarking purposes.

dataSecurity.title: Data Security
dataSecurity.paragraph1: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal information against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction.
dataSecurity.paragraph2: This includes encryption of sensitive data, secure hosting, regular security audits, and access controls.
dataSecurity.paragraph3: However, no method of transmission over the internet or electronic storage is 100% secure, and we cannot guarantee absolute security.

dataRetention.title: Data Retention
dataRetention.paragraph1: We retain your personal information only as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this Privacy Policy, or as required by law.
dataRetention.paragraph2: Beta user data will be retained throughout the beta period and for a reasonable time afterward for support and improvement purposes.
dataRetention.paragraph3: You may request deletion of your personal information at any time by contacting us.

cookies.title: Cookies and Tracking Technologies
cookies.paragraph1: Our website may use cookies, web beacons, and similar technologies to improve your experience and analyze website usage.
cookies.paragraph2: These technologies help us understand how visitors use our site and provide better functionality.
cookies.paragraph3: You can control cookie settings through your browser preferences.

international.title: International Data Transfers
international.paragraph1: Your information may be processed and stored in countries other than your own, where data protection laws may differ.
international.paragraph2: We ensure that any international transfers comply with applicable data protection laws and maintain appropriate safeguards.

children.title: Children's Privacy
children.paragraph1: DotCTL is not intended for use by individuals under 18 years of age.
children.paragraph2: We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 18.

rights.title: Your Rights and Choices
rights.point1: Access: Request a copy of the personal information we hold about you
rights.point2: Correction: Request correction of inaccurate or incomplete information
rights.point3: Deletion: Request deletion of your personal information (subject to legal limitations)
rights.point4: Portability: Request transfer of your data in a structured format
rights.point5: Objection: Object to our processing of your personal information
rights.point6: Restriction: Request restriction of processing in certain circumstances

changes.title: Changes to This Privacy Policy
changes.paragraph1: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or legal requirements.
changes.paragraph2: We will notify you of any material changes through our website or by other appropriate means.
changes.paragraph3: Your continued use of DotCTL after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated Privacy Policy.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.paragraph1: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy or our data practices, please contact us at:
contact.paragraph2: We will respond to your inquiries within 30 days.
